meanings.definition: A signaling or guiding device, typically a light or fire, used to warn or attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The beacon on the lighthouse helped ships find their way in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The campers followed the beacon of the bonfire to return to their tents.
meanings.sent3: The lost hikers mistook the beacon of the city lights for a shooting star.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a beacon of hope in the midst of despair.
meanings.sent5: The beacon of the emergency flare cut through the night sky, signaling for help.

meanings.definition: A source of inspiration or guidance.
meanings.sent1: His words were a beacon of wisdom in a confusing world.
meanings.sent2: The North Star served as a beacon for sailors navigating the seas.
meanings.sent3: The old lighthouse stood as a beacon of history along the coast.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art was a beacon that inspired others to create.
meanings.sent5: The beacon of her kindness lit up the room, spreading warmth to all around.

meanings.definition: To serve as a signal or warning.
meanings.sent1: The smoke beaconed for help from afar, alerting rescuers to their location.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the flowers beaconed bees to pollinate them.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of the bakery beaconed customers inside to buy fresh bread.
meanings.sent4: His eyes beaconed her to come closer, silently asking for a hug.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell beaconed the start of the race, prompting the runners to sprint forward.
